meta.name: description
meta.content: If you have any trouble playing Roblox, please review the following information. Some Common Symptoms Roblox is not being found by your...

If you have any trouble playing Roblox, please review the following information. Some Common Symptoms
Roblox is not being found by your browser – “cannot find Roblox” Endless Install Loop – playe...

div.p: If you have any trouble playing Roblox, please review the following information.

ul.li: Roblox is not being found by your browser – “cannot find Roblox”
Endless Install Loop – player is directed to install Roblox, even after they have done so
Roblox or Roblox Studio crashes when trying to connect to an online game, or when opening a place
Roblox or another program is still running while installing
Temporary Files are corrupted
Firewall is preventing Roblox from starting
Other Roblox files have become corrupted

div.p: Please try each step below, one at a time, in order. If one solution doesn't work, move on to the next!

p.em: Reboot

div.p: First reboot your computer and try to play. Sometimes this may be all that is needed to solve Roblox or Roblox Studio related problems.

p.em: Reset Internet Options for Windows

div.p: We have found that many Roblox and Roblox Studio issues can be solved by resetting your computer's Internet Options. Please keep in mind that these steps will need to use Internet Explorer, but will fix many problems even for players that use other browsers such as Chrome or Firefox. Please try the following :

ol.li: Open Internet Explorer
Open the gear icon > Internet options
Open the Advanced tab
Click the reset button

div.p: After resetting, please close the Internet Explorer to allow the changes to take effect. After this has been completed, you should be able to go back to using your web browser of choice.

p.em: Clear your Temporary Internet Files

div.p: An important step in any uninstall or reinstall process is to clear your browser's temporary internet files. This will help with any corruption issues that might have arisen. For assistance with this process, please click here and see the "Clear Your Temporary Internet Files and Cookies" section.

p.em: Check your Firewall

div.p: A lot of antivirus or internet security software tries to control which programs can access the internet. Often, these programs err on the side of caution and by default no program is allowed access. For assistance with looking into this and allowing Roblox through any blockages, click here.

p.em: Reinstall Roblox

div.p: For assistance with reinstalling, please click here.

p.em: Update Internet Explorer

div.p: Please try updating your Internet Explorer to the latest version. You can find that by clicking here Even if you do not currently use IE as a browser, you will still need to make sure you have the most updated version on your Windows machine in order for Roblox to work properly.
Always ensure that all programs are closed on your computer before installing or updating Roblox Also ensure that Internet Explorer is up to date with the latest version.
For more information on technical related matters, please see the following links:

meta.title: Safety Features: Chat, Privacy & Filtering – Roblox Support

meta.name: description
meta.content: Roblox is a great place to play fun games, express creativity and engage with friends and other members of the community. As a result of...

Roblox is a great place to play fun games, express creativity and engage with friends and other members of the community. As a result of this, we are visited by many great developers and players fr...

div.p: Roblox is a great place to play fun games, express creativity and engage with friends and other members of the community. As a result of this, we are visited by many great developers and players from various age groups and we strive to make this a safe and fun place for all of them. To aid in this process, we provide our users with a number of privacy settings and age-appropriate chat modes.

All chat on Roblox is filtered via a state of the art filtering system. Roblox accounts also have the option to restrict or disable chat throughout the site and in game. These settings can be adjusted from within the Privacy Tabs of the Account Settings page and this article provides further detail below.

Players age 12 and younger have their posts and chats filtered both for inappropriate content and behavior, and to prevent personal information from being posted. Players age 13 and older have the ability to say more words and phrases than younger players, but inappropriate chat and sharing personal information is restricted regardless of age. This filtering system covers all areas of communication on Roblox, public and private.

To help ensure clear visibility for parents into a player's expected experience, all Roblox accounts list the age bracket of the account in the upper-right corner of the navigation bar as either "Over 13 yrs" or "Under 13 yrs" depending on the date of birth. This is also displayed in game for the current player. This information is not displayed to other players and is only visible to the account user while logged in.

Accounts both under and over the age of 13 have the ability to limit or disable entirely who can chat with them both on the site or in-game, who can send them messages, and who can follow them into games or invite them to VIP Servers. Players age 12 and younger can select either “Friends” or “No one”, while players age 13 and older have additional options on who can interact with them.

All accounts have the option to enable a “Parent PIN”, which when active, requires a 4-digit code to make changes to an account. These settings can be adjusted from within the Security and Privacy Tabs of the Account Settings page, accessed by clicking on the gear icon in the upper-right corner of the site.

p.em: *Note* Turning off chat for "in app" will disable the Team Create option in Roblox Studio.

p.strong: As a Parent, How Can I See What My Children Are Doing on Roblox?

div.p: Roblox does have several ways to see the history for certain account activities. When logged in, you can view the following histories from their related sections:

li.div: Creations such as games, items, sounds, ads...etc (Develop)
Virtual item purchase and trade history (Trade)

div.p: Please be sure to enable 2-Step Verification as an added security measure for your account. This feature can be found in your Account Settings Security tab. For more information, please see our FAQ article with all the details of this great security feature.

An account is able to block other users that may be harassing, bullying or spamming, regardless of age. For more information on this feature as well as how to report rule violations to our moderation team, please click here.
For more information on matters related to account settings and security, please see the following links:

li.a: How to Install and Play Roblox Using Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, and Mozilla Firefox
How to Report Rule Violations and Block a User
My Account was "Hacked" - What do I do?
Account Security/Theft: Keeping your Account Safe! [*]

If another player is breaking Roblox rules (see the Roblox Rules of Conduct), then please use the Report Abuse button. To Report Abuse In-Game: 1. Click on Menu button, located at the upper left of...

header.h1: Reporting Abuse and Blocking Chat In-Game

div.p: If another player is breaking Roblox rules (see the Roblox Rules of Conduct), then please use the Report Abuse button.
To Report Abuse In-Game:

p.span: 1. Click on Menu button, located at the upper left of the screen. This icon looks like three lines stacked on top of each other.

div.p: 2. Click 'Report' tab at the top of the menu.
3. Click on the 'Which Player' pull-down menu, and select which player to report.
4. Click on the 'Type of Abuse' pull-down menu, to select the inappropriate action.
5. Additional details can be written in the Short Description box.
6. Click 'Submit' to finalize.

While it is definitely good to report any rule violations to our moderators, sometimes you may wish to keep certain users from being able to talk to you at all. This can be accomplished by blocking them. To do this, please try the following:
1. Find the user inside of the leaderboard/player list on the upper-right of the game screen. It will look like this:
2. If this list is not visible, it is likely just closed. To reopen it, click your username in the upper-right corner.
3. Once you have found the name of the user you wish to block inside of the leaderboard, click on it and a menu will open up.
4. Select Block User. You can also choose to Unblock them or Report Abuse directly from this menu as well.
Once you have blocked the user, the icon to the left of their name will turn into a circle with a line through it to indicate they have been blocked.
To disable the ability to chat in-game, perform the following steps:

ol.li: Log into the account
Go to your Account Settings page by clicking on the gear-icon, located in the upper-right corner of the page followed by Settings. Alternatively, you can click here
Click on the Privacy tab and under "Who can chat with me in game?", select "No one"
Scroll to the bottom of the screen and click "Save"

div.p: For more information on community related matters, including general info regarding abusive behavior on the website, please read see the following links:

strong.a: How To Report Rule Violations and Block Users

meta.title: My Account was "Hacked" - What do I do? – Roblox Support

meta.name: description
meta.content: If you think your account may have been hacked, we understand this can be a scary experience. That said, we're here to help. In addition...
My Account was "Hacked" - What do I do?

If you think your account may have been hacked, we understand this can be a scary experience. That said, we're here to help. In addition to the Roblox security features, remember that the ultimate ...

header.h1: My Account was "Hacked" - What do I do?

div.p: If you think your account may have been hacked, we understand this can be a scary experience. That said, we're here to help. In addition to the Roblox security features, remember that the ultimate power in account security rests in the hands of the player. So before we continue, please make sure you brush up on the ways to keep your account safe by clicking here. This also may help you in determining exactly how the account may have been hacked.
After reading up on the best methods for keeping an account secure, let's look into some ways to potentially get things recovered.

span.strong: If you downloaded something from another site or used an untrusted browser extension:

div.p: If there's a chance that your account may have been compromised due to accidentally downloading a bad program from another site on the internet, we'll want to work on getting rid of the malware first. If we don't, then your new password could also become compromised.

To do this, run a complete/thorough (not quick) scan using your anti-malware program of choice. After you are done, be sure to restart your computer. For added security, you may want to run the scan again to make sure any removed malware stays removed.

If you recently installed a browser extension, this may have allowed someone to compromise your account. We recommend removing all browser extensions just to be sure and only using browser extensions from verified and trusted sources.
If your account was compromised and your computer is free of malware/viruses, you'll want to reset your password. For assistance with this, please click here.

Please be sure to enable 2-Step Verification as an added security measure for your account. This feature can be found in your Account Settings Security tab. For more information, please see our FAQ article with all the details of this great security feature.

span.strong: If Resetting Your Password Doesn't Work

div.p: If resetting your password does not work and you need help getting back into your account, please see the following:

ul.li: Email info@roblox.com

You will be asked to verify ownership of the account. The best way to do this is to write to us from the account's original email or the billing email associated with the first purchase on the account
Even if your account is compromised and the email is changed, we can still see the original owner and/or billing email on the account
If your account did not have an email address or a credit card/PayPal purchase, we can still work with you to try to verify ownership and return the account

span.strong: If You Lost Items or Currency on Your Account

div.p: Compromised accounts are eligible for a one time restoration of items and/or currency lost or their approximate value. Please note that Roblox does not have a feature that allows us to revert an individual account to a previous state, but we still work to restore what we can to the best of our ability. For more information and to get the process started, please contact info@roblox.com.

p.em: Note: we require notification within 14 days of the account being compromised. Unfortunately, if we are not notified within this time, we are not typically able to issue a restore.

div.p: Roblox does not condone and cannot enforce or restore for players making deals for items, currency, etc. You should never make a trade or purchase an item because someone else promises you something in return. Report players attempting to make these deals with the Report Abuse feature.
Stealing accounts or items or currency is a severe violation of the Terms of Service. Any and all associated accounts involved in theft will be deleted.
Stay safe and secure! If something sounds too good to be true, don't risk it. You are the best defense against your account being compromised.
For more information on matters relating to account settings and security, please see the following links:

li.a: Account Security/Theft: Keeping your Account Safe! [*]
How Do I Change My Password?

meta.title: How to Install and Play Roblox Using Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, and Mozilla Firefox – Roblox Support

meta.name: description
meta.content: Chrome Update In April 2015, Roblox created a new install and launch flow for the Chrome browser in response to their removal of plugin...
How to Install and Play Roblox Using Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, and Mozilla Firefox

Chrome Update In April 2015, Roblox created a new install and launch flow for the Chrome browser in response to their removal of plugin support. This method will allow you to continue playing the R...

header.h1: How to Install and Play Roblox Using Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, and Mozilla Firefox

div.p: In April 2015, Roblox created a new install and launch flow for the Chrome browser in response to their removal of plugin support. This method will allow you to continue playing the Roblox games you know and love without needing to abandon Chrome, but things may look a bit different than they do on other browsers. The guide below will walk you through getting things set up.
If you already have Roblox installed on your system, please skip to the section after Step 4.

To begin playing on Chrome, we'll first need to get everything installed. Luckily, getting started is as easy as finding a game that you would like to play from our Games Page, clicking on it and selecting the green Play button. This message will then appear:

Simply click the green "Download and Install Roblox" button and the downloading will begin. After this process has completed, Chrome will display a screen containing a series of instructions to follow. They are:

ol.li: Click RobloxPlayerLauncher.exe in your browser's download bar to run the Roblox installer.
Click Run when prompted by your computer to begin the installation process.
Click OK once you've successfully installed Roblox
Click the green Play button.

div.p: After step four, you will be given an "External Protocol Request" that looks like this:
This box is perfectly normal: the Roblox.com website tells Chrome to open the Roblox game (or Roblox Studio), and Chrome is just making sure this is what you want to do.

Check the "Remember my choice for all links of this type" box followed by clicking the Launch Application button. Roblox will then configure itself and open up as normal and this will prevent the box from showing up again in the future.

In July 2015, Windows 10 was released to the public and along with it came the Microsoft Edge browser. The install process for Roblox on Edge is very similar to the process for the April 2015 Chrome update. Read above for more details.
As with Microsoft Edge, the install process for Roblox is very similar to the process for the April 2015 Chrome update. Read above for more details.

p.em: If you accidentally checked "Remember my choice for all links of this type" and clicked the Do Nothing button, Chrome will remember your choice and will not prompt you again. This will make Roblox unplayable. To fix this, close all your open Chrome browsers,
, then reinstall following the above steps.

div.p: For more information on technical related matters, please see the following links:

strong.a: Other Frequently Asked Questions and Technical Solutions

li.a: How Do I Reinstall the Roblox Software?

meta.name: description
meta.content: Roblox offers developers many ways to make their games immersive and dynamic. One of these ways is through the use of audio. Players can...

Roblox offers developers many ways to make their games immersive and dynamic. One of these ways is through the use of audio. Players can upload mp3s or OGG files and can then add them to their plac...

div.p: Roblox offers developers many ways to make their games immersive and dynamic. One of these ways is through the use of audio. Players can upload mp3s or OGG files and can then add them to their places as background music, narration, sound effects and more!
Uploading can easily be done through the roblox.com website. To do this:

ol.li: Log into your account on roblox.com
Click Develop in the blue bar at the top of the screen
Click on Audio
Click Browse, and select an audio file
Once selected, click Estimate Price to determine the Robux cost of your upload

li.span: After you make your selection click Purchase for XR$ to finalize your purchase

p.em: Note: Audio uploads must be less than 6 minutes, smaller than 10.0 MB, clear and easy to understand. This means that audio cannot be sped up, slowed down, or had its volume excessively altered; and must otherwise meet our Roblox Rules of Conduct.

div.p: 20 Robux for 0-10 seconds
35 Robux for 10-30 seconds
70 Robux for 30 seconds-2 minutes
350 Robux for 2 minutes-7 minutes

Once uploaded, the audio file can be further customized on the Configure page. To locate this page, click on the gear-icon located to the right of the uploaded file in the Audio tab of your Develop section.
The Configure page has the following options:

ul.li: Name: Allows you to change the audio file's name
Description: A summary of the audio file
Turn comments on/off: Choose whether or not this item is open for comments
Genre: Classify your audio to help people find it
Make Free: Choose whether or not this item is freely available to all users. If this is not checked, the audio will only be able to be used by you

p.em: Note: Names and descriptions are subject to our white/blacklist filters. For more information on these filters please click here.

div.p: There are a number of creative ways that our developers can use sound. For details on how to do this, please click here and see the section labeled 'Implementing Audio.'

p.span: For more information on gameplay and building related matters, please see the following links:

a.strong: Full Gameplay and Building Help Section

meta.title: How to Make Ads – Roblox Support

meta.name: description
meta.content: Once you have created the game, group, or piece of clothing of your dreams, it's time to get the word out so that other players can start...

Once you have created the game, group, or piece of clothing of your dreams, it's time to get the word out so that other players can start enjoying the fruit of your labors. While word of mouth is a...

li.title: Places and Building: Advertising and Stats
li.a: Places and Building: Advertising and Stats

div.p: Once you have created the game, group, or piece of clothing of your dreams, it's time to get the word out so that other players can start enjoying the fruit of your labors. While word of mouth is a powerful tool on its own, Roblox offers several tools to help get you started. One of these tools is the User Ads feature.

Ads are images that players upload that can be use to promote their places, clothing, models, decals, groups...etc. These will be displayed at the top and sides of Roblox.com, and when the image is clicked, it will take you to the thing that is being advertised.

Advertising is a good way to bring attention to the awesome stuff that you have built or made. You may even be able to make Robux by bidding on ads for an item which other players may then purchase or visit.

The User Ads feature utilizes a bidding system similar to the one seen in Sponsored Games. Developers can use their image editor of choice to create an awesome looking ad for a specific place or item and then bid in Robux on the frequency that that ad will display.

Advertisers don't buy ad space on Roblox. They bid for it in an auction and do so on every day they wish the ad to be shown. There is a limited amount of ad space to go around (we only show so many ads per day), so an auction is run and the frequency that an ad is displayed is determined by how much is bid and how much other players have also bid.
In general, if you spend twice as much, your promotion will be seen about twice as many times. For example, say three developers are all bidding to have their ads featured. The bids are as follows:

ul.li: Developer A bids 50 Robux
Developer B bids 100 Robux
Developer C bids 300 Robux

div.p: In this example, Developer A bid the least amount of Robux, so their ad will appear the least amount of times. Developer B bid twice as many Robux so their ad will appear twice as often. Developer C bid six times as many Robux as Developer A did so their ad will appear six times as often.

p.strong: Things to Know About the Auction System

p.span: There are 3 different sized ads: banners, skyscrapers, and large rectangles. A banner ad can't go in a skyscraper slot and vice versa. Thus, unlike the example in the section above, there are actually 3 separate auctions going on at all times for each of the different sized ads.

There are different numbers of slots for each of the ad types on Roblox. For example, the large rectangle only appears on the Home and Profile pages. The banner, on the other hand, is on nearly every page. In theory this means that you should bid less on the large rectangle slots, because even if you win a large percentage of all rectangle auctions, you are still getting fewer relative impressions.

div.p: Impression - Every time a player sees your ad, that is 1 "impression".
Clicks - Every time a player clicks on your ad, that is 1 "click".

CTR - CTR is short for Click Through Rate. Simply, it is the percentage of people who see your ad that also clicks on that ad (clicks / impressions). If everyone who sees your ad clicks on it, you have a CTR of 100%. Good ads have a high CTR. A high CTR means you are buying clicks for cheap. A low CTR means you have to show your ad to a ton of people to get many clicks at all; and this is expensive.
Run - When you bid to display an ad, you are launching the ad on a "run". Currently all runs last for 24 hours.
Banner - A banner ad is a 728 x 90 pixel ad.
Skyscraper - A skyscraper ad is a 160 x 600 pixel ad.
Large Rectangle - A large rectangle ad is 300 x 250 pixel ad.
Campaign - A ad campaign is a series of ads that are all advertising the same thing. The Roblox ad system doesn't support campaigns specifically.

CPC - "Cost Per Click". The Roblox ad system does not currently show you your CPC, but it is a very useful concept. Put plainly, it is the number of tickets you have to bid to get a single click. CPC = CTR * Bid. Good ads will have a low CPC. Bad ads will have a large CPC.
If you would like to make an ad for your creations, you can do so in the following way:

ol.li: Log into your account on roblox.com
Click on Develop in the blue bar at the top of the screen
Click on the section corresponding to the type of item you would like to advertise in the left column
Find the item you would like to promote and click the gear icon to its right
Select Advertise in the menu that pops up
A screen will display that looks like this:
Click the download button next to the type of ad you would like to make to get its template

Use your image editor of choice (such as MS Paint) to edit the template and make your ad. Be careful not to change the template's size Make sure that you save the ad in .png format and that it adheres to the Roblox Rules of Conduct
Back on the website, click the Browse button next to "Upload an Ad" to find the file you just made
Title your ad by typing a name into the Name Your Ad box
Click the Upload button

div.p: This will then create an entry in the User Ads tab of your Develop section. To activate the ad, click on the gear icon to the right of it and select Run in the menu that displays. Enter in how many Robux you would like to bid and click the Run button.

p.strong: How Do I Tell How Well My Promotion is Doing?

div.p: Once you have everything up and running, you can come back to your Develop section's User Ads tab later in the day to see how much it has paid off! Underneath the ad's entry will be a series of numbers:

ul.li: Impressions: this is the number of times that people have seen your ad
Clicks: the number of times people have clicked on it
CTR: of the people that have seen your ad, this is the percentage of them that clicked on it
Bid: the amount of Robux that you bid for the promotion

p.span: For more information on gameplay and building related matters, please see the following links:

strong.a: How to Design an Effective Ad
Places and Building: Advertising and Stats

meta.name: description
meta.content: Once you have created the game of your dreams, it's time to get the word out so that other players can start enjoying the fruit of your...

Once you have created the game of your dreams, it's time to get the word out so that other players can start enjoying the fruit of your labors. While word of mouth is a powerful tool on its own, Ro...

li.title: Places and Building: Advertising and Stats
li.a: Places and Building: Advertising and Stats

div.p: Once you have created the game of your dreams, it's time to get the word out so that other players can start enjoying the fruit of your labors. While word of mouth is a powerful tool on its own, Roblox offers several tools to help get you started. One of these tools is the Sponsored Games feature.

Sponsored Games, also known as native ads, are promotions for games that will appear directly in the various game sorts/lists when browsing that may have otherwise appeared in other positions. They will be clearly marked as sponsored but will otherwise look and behave just as any of the other choices available.

The Sponsored Games feature utilizes a bidding system similar to the one seen in User Ads. Developers will bid in Robux every day that they would like their promotion to run and for the specific platform (web, tablet, or phone) in which they would like it to appear.

The frequency that a game will be placed into a sponsored slot is based on how much its developer bids and how much other players are bidding for the same platform. For example, let's say three developers are all bidding to have their games featured on tablets. The bids are as follows:

ul.li: Developer A bids 50 Robux
Developer B bids 100 Robux
Developer C bids 300 Robux

div.p: In this example, Developer A bid the least amount of Robux so their game will appear in sponsored slots the least amount of times. Developer B bid twice as many Robux so their game will appear in these slots twice as often. Developer C bid six times as many Robux as Developer A did so their game will appear six times as often.
If you would like to take place in the Sponsored Game system, you can do so in the following way:

ol.li: Log into your account on roblox.com
Click on Develop in the blue bar at the top of the screen
Click on Games in the left column
Find the game you would like to promote and click the gear icon to the right of it
Select Sponsor in the menu that pops up
A screen will display that looks like this:
Check the box for each platform you would like to bid on
Click the Create button

div.p: This will then create an entry in the Sponsored Games tab of your Develop section for each platform you selected. To activate the ad, click on the gear icon to the right of it and select Run in the menu that displays. Enter in how many Robux you would like to bid and click the Run button.

p.strong: How Do I Tell How Well My Promotion is Doing?

div.p: Once you have everything up and running, you can come back to your Develop section's Sponsored Games tab later in the day to see how much it has paid off! Underneath the ad's entry will be a series of numbers:

ul.li: Total Impr: this is the number of times that people have seen your ad
Total Clicks: the number of times people have clicked on it
Total CTR: of the people that have seen your ad, this is the percentage of them that clicked on it
Total Bid: the amount of Robux that you bid for the promotion

p.span: For more information on gameplay and building related matters, please see the following links:

strong.a: Places and Building: Advertising and Stats

div.h1: Developer Exchange – Help and Information Page
div.p: This is the help and information page for the Developer Exchange, which we call DevEx.
The eligibility requirements to use DevEx, ongoing service requirements for developers and other relevant information can be found at the DevEx Terms of Use.

ol.li: If you (a user of Roblox who is 13 years of age or older) have the requisite minimum amount of Robux in your account (as set out in the DevEx Terms), and are a member of the Outrageous Builders Club, you will be presented with an option to exchange your Robux for U.S. dollars at the then current exchange rate set by Roblox (“Cash Out”). That option to Cash Out will be presented as a “Cash Out” button on your account page. To initiate a Cash Out request, click the “Cash Out” button and enter all requested information (i.e. full name and full address*), along with your phone number, email address, and ROBLOX password. Once done, select from the available payout (exchange rate) options, signify your continued agreement to the Terms and Conditions by clicking the associated check-box, and again click the "Cash Out" button. We will then review the request.

*Note: If your country is not available, select United States. After submitting the form, send an email to DevEx@roblox.com with an explanation of your issue, along with the desired country not in the list. Make sure to include your username in the email.

If your request is approved, and if this is your first time cashing out, you will receive an email inviting you to create an account on our DevEx portal. You will be prompted to enter your information at account creation. Please make sure your information is entered accurately into the DevEx portal, and is kept up to date at all times. The information you provide is used to ensure all payments comply with applicable laws and regulations. Inaccuracies in information provided could impact your payment.

div.p: The maximum exchange through DevEx each month is $140,000 USD.

ol.li:
Rates. The following exchange rates will apply to DevEx. Please note that for anyone who has earned Robux prior to March 1, 2017, each rate below might apply to a different part of your holdings.
New Rate. $.0035/R$ (which comes out to $350 USD for 100,000 Robux). This rate applies to all Robux earned on or after March 1, 2017.
Old Rate. $.0025/R$ (which comes out to $250 USD for 100,000 Robux). This rate applies to all Robux earned before March 1, 2017.

div.h3: Important Notes Related to the Exchange Rates - Please Read

ol.li: Anyone with a “Historical Balance” (i.e., a current Robux balance as of the start March 1, 2017) will have DevEx funds pulled from their account at the Ol

meta.name: description
meta.content:
Roblox Wiki is a group on ROBLOX owned by UristMcSparks with 53213 members. Roblox Wiki: http://wiki.roblox.com/ ================================= The official Roblox Wiki group. The purpose of this group is:
1) Normal users to give the wiki staff ideas and suggestions. 2) The wiki staff to collaborate in a more organized and efficient manner.
Wiki applications are always open. The application can be found here: http://polls.roblox.com/roblox-wiki-writer-application
Please join if you are a wiki supporter and would like to share your ideas to the people actually who write the wiki.
